website_summaries.verdict: Under Armour's penchant for athleisure shoes continues with the RailFit TXT. As one of the recent additions to the growing Railfit collection, it features the movable lace loops and elastic heel strap, the trademark of these sneakers. Comfort and support have been attested by most of its reviews, allowing the casual shoe to be utilized for some strenuous activities such as gym workouts. Because of its impressive qualities, getting a pair or two wouldn’t be considered excessive.
pros: According to some wearers, the athleisure sneaker could be used for working out because of its support features
For most of its users, the Under Armour RailFit TXT is undoubtedly comfortable
Due to the low-top’s overall features, a couple of customers have purchased multiple pairs
One buyer shared that due to the design of the shoe, she got many compliments
The slip-on foot entry is hassle-free, as per a reviewer
As per a commenter, the lightweight properties of this UA sneaker is praise-worthy
cons: Several customers warned that the UA RailFit TXT runs smaller than the standard size

customer_reviews.title: Awesome price on a nice quality pair of UA sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I Love Under Armour products! Their sneakers do run small I learned, so I always order 1/2-1 size up and then they fit great. I now own 7 pairs of UA sneakers. Great style and quality as always! Another great buy from Under Armour and Amazon! Got these for under $30! Awesome deal!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Lo Pic

customer_reviews.title: Buy half size up for comfort ...
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable affordable sneakers I ever purchased. Wear with jeans or jogging pants always looks good... I'm a 6 / and purchased a 7 half size bigger Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing for the price. I’m a nurse in an ER and my feet do not hurt at the end of the shift
customer_reviews.author: ibirene

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Label says 11 and my toes a scrunched at the top. No way these are 11’s. More like a 9.5 or 10 tops. Not impressed regardless of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: They were so inexpensive and so cute! Perfect for leggings!
customer_reviews.author: Mama Xox

customer_reviews.title: Kind of tight so up one size!
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe, it is very light weight but you may want to up one size! Tight snug!
customer_reviews.author: Hailey Wroten

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Like the shoes but run a bit small. You don’t have to tie the laces except for looks only.
customer_reviews.author: Lor

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to get on!
customer_reviews.text: I do like them however my only objection is how difficult they are to get on.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected. True to size.
customer_reviews.text: As a nurse on my feet for 12hrs + a day I was hoping for more comfort. Otherwise they would be great. Fit good.
customer_reviews.author: Lacia T.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I ordered them to wear for my summer walking shoes. They are light weight easy to put on and just go. I am over weight and working on it lol they feel like wearing a sock or slipper. My feet like them. I am thinking about buying another pair. Buy them if your looking for a liggt weight slip on and go shoe great for walking.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

product_meta.title: Under Armour Women's Railfit Txt Sneaker
feature_bullets: Dual layer mesh & soft foam upper provides flexible, form fitting support
Slip on construction for quick & easy entry
Rail fit lacing system features movable lace loops that slide back & forth for a completely adjustable fit
Elastic heel strap locks in the back of the foot
Embedded footbed for step in comfort
